lines: Cognitive Screening Assessment (MoCA-Aligned, Self-Adapted AI Version)
Purpose: Screen for possible cognitive difficulties
Domains: Attention, Memory, Executive Function, Language
The following tasks check attention, memory, and thinking skills.
There are no right or wrong results.
Please answer to the best of your ability.
Please repeat the following number sequence exactly as shown:
•  0 – I could not repeat the sequence correctly.
Now repeat this sequence in reverse order:
•  1 – I repeated the sequence correctly in reverse.
•  0 – I could not repeat the sequence correctly.
Please count how many times the letter “A” appears in the sequence below:
F – A – B – C – A – D – E – A – G
Which option best completes the pattern?
Which comes next in the series?
Please read and remember these words:
No scoring here — used for later recall.
Which of the following words do you remember seeing earlier?
•  1 point per correct word recalled / 0 points for incorrect selections {(Max: 5 points)}
Which word best describes both a bicycle and a car?
Which sentence makes the most sense?
•  1 – “The child drank water because they were thirsty.”
•  0 – “The child drank water because it was sleeping.”
•  0 – I answered incorrectly or was unsure.
•  1 – I correctly identified my location (home, office, city, etc.).
•  0 – I could not clearly identify my location.
Total Cognitive Screening Score = Sum of all item scores
Possible cognitive concern – recommend professional assessment
This does NOT diagnose dementia, MCI, or neurological disease.
“Your responses suggest possible difficulty with attention or memory. This is only a screening result.”
•  Detect brain fog (stress, depression, sleep loss)
“We use a self-adapted, MoCA-aligned cognitive screener to flag possible attention and memory
difficulties, strictly for screening and referral, not diagnosis.”
